conclusion: Determine the work done by the frictional force on the object as it is transported from point M to point N.
Calculate the frictional force using f = μmg, resulting in f = 9 N.
Determine the acceleration of the object using a = f/m, resulting in a = 3 m/s².
Calculate the time taken for the object to reach the speed of the conveyor belt using t = v/a, resulting in t = 2 s.
Calculate the distance traveled by the object during acceleration using d = 1/2 at², resulting in d = 6 m.
Determine the remaining distance traveled at constant speed using d_remaining = L1 - d, resulting in d_remaining = 4 m.
Calculate the work done by the frictional force using W = f × d, resulting in W = 54 J.
The work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object as it is transported from point M to point N is 54 J.
